channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: 10年の歴史を持つ政治漫画とノンフィクション漫画のサイト兼印刷雑誌「The Nib」が、9月1日の特別版で発行を終了（マット・ボルス／ボルスコミックス）
item.description:
Matt Bors / Bors Comics:
The Nib, a 10-year-old site and print magazine for political cartoons and non-fiction comics, ends publication with a special edition on September 1  —  After ten years, the comics publication I founded shuts down this Friday.  —  This week is the final week of The Nib.

item.title: 書簡：UFC、NBA、NFLがUSPTOに対し、DMCAを更新してライブコンテンツを「即座に、またはほぼ即座に」削除できるようにする必要があると伝える（Ernesto Van der Sar/TorrentFreak）
item.description:
Ernesto Van der Sar / TorrentFreak:
Letter: the UFC, the NBA, and the NFL tell the USPTO that the DMCA needs to be updated so live content can be removed “instantaneously or near-instantaneously”  —  The UFC, NBA and NFL are without a doubt among the most recognizable sports brands in the world.

item.title: オンライン・ニュース協会の創設者であり、2005年にWashingtonPost.comのエグゼクティブ・エディターを引退したワシントン・ポスト紙の記者、ダグラス・フィーバー氏が84歳で死去（Bart Barnes/Washington Post）。
item.description:
Bart Barnes / Washington Post:
Douglas Feaver, an Online News Association founder and a Washington Post reporter who retired as WashingtonPost.com's executive editor in 2005, dies at 84  —  As a reporter in the 1970s and 1980s, he specialized in writing about transportation.  He also was assistant Metropolitan editor and a business desk editor.

item.title: SimilarwebとData.ai：Metaがカナダでニュースをブロックしても、カナダ人のFacebook利用にはほとんど影響なし。
item.description:
Reuters:
Similarweb and Data.ai: Meta blocking news in Canada barely impacted Canadians' Facebook usage, backing Meta's claim that news has little value for the company  —  Meta's (META.O) decision to block news links in Canada this month has had almost no impact on Canadians' usage of Facebook …

item.title: テキサス・トリビューン紙が初のレイオフを実施したのは、各機関がスポンサーを引き揚げ、収入が前年比5％減少したことによる予算不足のため。
item.description:
Sarah Scire / Nieman Lab:
The Texas Tribune blames its first-ever layoffs on a budget shortfall after institutions pulled sponsorships and revenue fell 5% YoY; some blame its leadership  —  Frustration over a lack of transparency has been amplified by the newsroom's status as “the gold standard of nonprofit journalism” …

item.title: Xは "安全性 "に関するブログ記事で、米国で始まる "有料で宣伝される政治投稿 "と、"グローバルな広告の透明性センターを提供する "計画を発表した（Mark Sullivan/Fast Company）。
item.description:
Mark Sullivan / Fast Company:
In a “safety” blog post, X announces “paid-for promoted political posts”, starting in the US, and plans to “provide a global advertising transparency center”  —  X (née Twitter) published a “safety” brief on its blog today outlining new policies …

item.title: デイリー・ワイヤーは、9月8日にXで10部構成のドキュメンタリー番組『Convicting a Murderer』の第1話を無料公開し、Xの広告に6桁を費やす予定（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
The Daily Wire plans to debut the first episode of Convicting a Murderer, its 10-part docuseries, for free on X on September 8 and spend six figures on X ads  —  The Daily Wire, a conservative media and entertainment company, will debut its first full-length docuseries Sept. 8 on X …

item.title: 英インディペンデント紙、ザック・レナード社長の後任としてクリスチャン・ブロートン常務取締役をCEOに指名、グローバルCOOとして米国事業の成長に取り組む（Charlotte Tobitt/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Charlotte Tobitt / Press Gazette:
UK-based The Independent names Managing Director Christian Broughton as its CEO, succeeding Zach Leonard, who will work on growing the US business as global COO  —  The Independent has appointed Christian Broughton, its managing director and former editor, as its next chief executive as it seeks …

item.title: Disney、Bloomberg、WaPo、The Atlantic、Axios、ABC、ESPN、Condé Nast、Hearst、VoxなどがNYTとReutersとともにOpenAIのGPTBotウェブクローラーをブロック（Oliver Darcy/CNN）
item.description:
Oliver Darcy / CNN:
Disney, Bloomberg, WaPo, The Atlantic, Axios, ABC, ESPN, Condé Nast, Hearst, Vox, and others join the NYT and Reuters in blocking OpenAI's GPTBot web crawler  —  Editor's Note: A version of this article first appeared in the “Reliable Sources” newsletter.

item.title: 出典：8月22日、ワシントン・ポストはテクノロジー部門であるアークXPのトップ・マーケティング・スタッフ、プログラム・マネージャー、プロダクト・デザイナーを数名、静かに解雇した（Max Tani/Semafor）
item.description:
Max Tani / Semafor:
Source: on August 22, The Washington Post quietly laid off several top marketing staff, program managers, and product designers at Arc XP, its technology arm  —  The Scoop  —  The Washington Post has quietly laid off staff from Arc XP, the technology arm of the paper that Post leadership …

item.title: YouTubeは現在、クリエイターが警告を受けた際に教育トレーニングコースを受講できるようにしており、90日間同じポリシーに違反しなければ解除される（Sarah Perez/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Sarah Perez / TechCrunch:
YouTube now lets creators take an educational training course when they receive a warning, which YouTube lifts if they don't violate the same policy for 90 days  —  YouTube announced this morning a change to its Community Guidelines that impact creators who break its rules.

item.title: Fox SportsがGoogle CloudのVertex AI Visionシステムを使って190万本以上の動画から映像を検索し、新しいTV、ソーシャル、マーケティングコンテンツを制作する契約を締結（Todd Spangler/Variety）
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
Fox Sports signs a deal to use Google Cloud's Vertex AI Vision system to search footage from 1.9M+ videos and produce new TV, social, and marketing content  —  Fox Corp.'s Fox Sports is turning to generative artificial-intelligence to help its staffers more rapidly generate content from millions of hours of its archived games footage.

item.title: Snapは、Lensaらが普及させたジェネレーティブAIセルフィーにSnapchatが挑戦した「Dreams」を展開、8枚の写真パックに1ドル課金、最初の1枚は無料（Alex Heath/The Verge）
item.description:
Alex Heath / The Verge:
Snap rolls out Dreams, Snapchat's take on the generative AI selfies that Lensa and others popularized, charging $1 for an eight-photo pack; the first is free  —  After releasing its My AI chatbot earlier this year, Snapchat is now jumping on the AI selfie bandwagon with a new feature called Dreams.

item.title: TechCrunchが6万人のニュースレター購読者を持つコニー・ロイゾスのメディア・スタートアップStrictlyVCを買収、ロイゾスを編集長兼ゼネラル・マネージャーに任命（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
TechCrunch acquires Connie Loizos' media startup StrictlyVC, which has 60K newsletter subscribers, and appoints Loizos as editor-in-chief and general manager  —  TechCrunch, the digital tech and business publication owned by Yahoo, has acquired StrictlyVC, a media startup, from longtime Silicon Valley journalist Connie Lozois.

item.title: グーグル、AIが生成した画像に目に見えないデジタル「透かし」を埋め込むツール「SynthID」を発表、Imagen製画像のクラウド顧客向けに提供中（Gerrit De Vynck/Washington Post）
item.description:
Gerrit De Vynck / Washington Post:
Google unveils SynthID, a tool that can embed an invisible digital “watermark” into AI-generated images, available now to Cloud customers for Imagen-made images  —  The tech giant is among companies pushing out AI tools while promising to build more tools to protect against their misuse
